decision_conditions: It is recommended that the two Ash trees shown as group G2 on the plan of Havering's TPO 19/85 can be removed and two more suitable trees be planted to replace them in the same location.

That the trees for which consent for removal is granted shall be replaced by two Flowering cherries which should be, heavy-standard container grown stock, 12-14 cm girth, planted in the soft landscaped area, within 2m of the original Ash trees that are on the right hand flank of 14 Spinney Close, within the first available planting season (November to March) following the removal of the original trees. Failure to plant the replacement trees as required can lead to enforcement action.
THE APPLICANT SHALL NOTIFY THE LOCAL PLANNING AUTHORITY IN WRITING WITHIN TWO MONTHS OF THE PLANTING BEING CARRIED OUT, SO THAT THE REPLACEMENT TREES CAN BE INSPECTED.
In the interests of public amenity and to enable the Council to update its records.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
description: Two Ash trees in front garden to be felled as have shaggy bracket fungus (Inonotus hispidus).
